name: df-dim
body: |- wceq(cldim, cmpt(s0, universe, cuni(cima(chash, cfv(clbs, cv(s0))))))

comment: Define the dimension of a vector space as the cardinality of its bases. Note that by ~ lvecdim , all bases are equinumerous. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 6-May-2023.)
